actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Homeland Security.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Border and Maritime Security.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Border Security and Enforcement

official_title: To require the submission of a plan to ensure the placement of sufficient U.S. Customs and Border Protection officers at  each of the ten international airports in the United States  with the largest volume of international travelers to effectively combat security threats and vulnerabilities, and  for other purposes.
subjects: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

summary.text: Directs the Secretary of Homeland Security (DHS), acting through the U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP), to submit to Congress a plan for ensuring the placement of sufficient CBP officers at each of the 10 U.S. international airports with the largest volume of international travelers.

titles.title: To require the submission of a plan to ensure the placement of sufficient U.S. Customs and Border Protection officers at  each of the ten international airports in the United States  with the largest volume of international travelers to effectively combat security threats and vulnerabilities, and  for other purposes.
